title: California man found guilty of murdering teens who ding-dong ditched his house
description: Riverside County resident Anurag Chandra was found guilty of killing three teenage boys who played ding-dong ditch at his house. Chandra had rammed their car into a tree after the prank.

title: Los Angeles police find dead premature baby with umbilical cord near trash bin
description: A dead male fetus who was seven months into gestation was discovered laying face-down near a trash can at Whittier Narrows Recreational Area in Los Angeles County, California police say.

title: Bengals fan trolls NFL with mock coin-flip before announcing draft pick
description: The Cincinnati Bengals' fate of where they would play a playoff game was almost decided by a coin flip, which their fans are clearly still upset about.

title: Texas woman Sarah Hartsfield accused of killing 5th husband with insulin
description: Sarah Hartsfield has been charged with killing husband number five, and law enforcement reopened an investigation into her previous fiance's death

title: Alec Baldwin's 'Rust' character hanged by noose after deadly shooting
description: 65-year-old actor Alec Baldwin was spotted on the "Rust" set with his neck placed around a noose. His shirt was blood-stained from being shot during filming.

title: Two Democrat governors sign laws aiming to help out-of-state minors get sex change surgeries, abortions
description: Minnesota and Washington – both led by Democrat governors – have enacted laws for those who travel to their states seeking an abortion or sex-change surgeries.

title: Colorado Dems vote against harsher penalties for indecent exposure to kids because it could 'ban drag shows'
description: Colorado Democrats voted against a measure to enhance criminal penalties for indecent exposure in view of a minor, with one lawmaker claiming the bill could “ban" drag shows.

title: LeBron James sends cryptic song lyrics on social media after knocking Grizzlies out of playoffs
description: LeBron James usually goes into "zero dark thirty" mode in the playoffs, but after upsetting the Memphis Grizzlies, he made a brief return to send a message.

title: Michael J. Fox says 'I'm not going to be 80' amid ongoing battle with Parkinson’s disease
description: "Back to the Future" actor Michael J. Fox, 61, revealed his changed perspective on mortality and said he doesn't believe he'll live to age 80.

title: Lions trade D'Andre Swift to Eagles, two days after drafting Jahmyr Gibbs
description: The Lions made a surprising move Thursday by selecting running back Jahmyr Gibbs in the first round. D'Andre Swift appears to be the odd man out for Detroit.

title: Ana Walshe murder: Husband Brian Walshe threw out hacksaw with potential key piece of evidence: documents
description: Brian Walshe allegedly threw out a hacksaw that has a potential key piece of evidence in his wife Ana Walshe's murder case

title: Bar that kicked out customers after Bud Light controversy makes desperate plea to win back business
description: An Indiana bar that rejected patrons who were vocal about boycotting Bud Light is asking them to come back to the restaurant.

title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. says he opposes biological males competing in women's sports
description: Democratic presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said Saturday morning he is "against people participating in women's sports who are biologically male."

title: Saturday morning gunfire erupts at South Carolina park, 9 injured: Sheriff
description: A shooting at a park in South Carolina on early Saturday morning left nine people injured, according to the Richland County Sheriff's Office.

title: 2023 NFL Draft: Two-time national champion Stetson Bennett selected by Rams in fourth round
description: Two-time national champion Stetson Bennett was selected by the Los Angeles Rams in the fourth round of the 2023 NFL Draft, making him the seventh quarterback selected.

title: White Sox's Liam Hendriks dominates in first outing since becoming cancer-free
description: Liam Hendriks announced less than two weeks ago that he is "cancer free" and in remission, so he didn't waste too much time in dominating on the rubber again.

title: Florida commission slaps down Trump PAC's ethics complaint against DeSantis
description: The Florida Commission on Ethics has dismissed a complaint filed by allies of former President Donald Trump who accused Gov. Ron DeSantis of accepting illegal gifts.

title: UVA grad recounts 'huge impact' BLM activist's racism allegation has had on her life
description: A former University of Virginia student who was accused of threatening Black Lives Matter protestors in 2020 opened up about the effect the scandal had on her life.

title: Webb Space Telescope sees massive protocluster of galaxies in the early universe
description: Using data from the James Webb Space Telescope, a protocluster of seven galaxies has been confirmed just 650 million years after the big bang, for the first time.

title: Grizzlies' Ja Morant says off-the-court issues impacted season after blowout loss to Lakers
description: Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant pointed to his off-the-field issues Friday, saying they impacted the season. The Grizzlies' season came to end in six games to the Lakers.

title: After failing to close out at home, Kraken travel to Colorado to face defending champion Avalanche in Game 7
description: For the first time in their short history, the Seattle Kraken will play in a Game 7, when they face the Colorado Avalanche to determine which team will advance to the next round.

title: California to see triple digits as thunderstorms rumble across Gulf Coast
description: Thunderstorms are impacting the eastern U.S. over the weekend as the West Coast sees warm weather, and triple-digit temperatures could hit southern California.

title: Parents of multiple children might be getting it all wrong — here's how to connect with each kid
description: In a busy, demanding world, how do parents make sure each child is given one-on-one time — and that parents truly connect with each kid? Here are three ways parents can make each child feel special.

title: Tech expert warns AI could threaten human connectivity, romance: 'Latest version of a long tradition'
description: Technologist David Auerbach weighs in on the debate surrounding the rapid development of artificial intelligence and its impact on the future of humanity.

title: Prolific sperm donor with over 500 children must pay $110K if he donates again, court rules
description: Jonathan Jacob Meijer told mothers that he had adhered to legal limits on sperm donation even though he had already fathered hundreds of children in the Netherlands.

title: US evacuates private citizens from Sudan for first time
description: The bus convoy traveled over 500 miles to Port Sudan on the Red Sea, completing the first evacuation during a lull in fighting that occurred due to joint diplomatic efforts.

title: Boats are learning to fly above the water – here's how
description: The boating industry has upgraded their vehicles for a safer, smoother and efficient ride that flies a few feet above the water with new technology and designs.

title: Judge shreds Soros-backed prosecutor, moves to hold her in criminal contempt: 'Rudderless ship of chaos'
description: A Missouri judge moved to hold a George Soros-bankrolled prosecutor in criminal contempt, lambasting her office as a "rudderless ship of chaos."

title: King Charles' coronation: Tom Cruise, Winnie the Pooh, Nicole Scherzinger added to royal concert lineup
description: Celebrities Tom Cruise, Nicole Scherzinger and Winnie the Pooh have been added to the star-studded lineup for King Charles III's coronation concert on May 7.

title: Lucky bounce leads to unreal diving catch by Missouri Tigers left fielder
description: Missouri Tigers left fielder Cam Chick made an incredible play in left field Friday night against the Florida Gators due to a lucky bounce of the ball.

title: Satire site ‘The Onion’ ripped for joking about Disney character murdering Gov. DeSantis: ‘Jarringly unfunny'
description: Twitter users torched satire site "The Onion" for making a post fantasizing about Disney character Goofy brutally murdering Gov. Ron DeSantis, R-Fla., with a crowbar.

title: Cyberwhat? These are the Ram trucks of the future, according to high schoolers
description: Rocco Morales won the 2023 Drive for Design contest with a futuristic electric pickup concept called the Ram Stadion that can convert into a hang-out space.

title: Army grounds aviation units for training after helicopter crashes
description: The Army grounded aviation units for training after deadly helicopter crashes over the last few months in Alaska and Kentucky. The crashes took the lives of 12 people.

title: Melatonin gummies found to contain potentially dangerous levels of the hormone: study
description: Over 60% of surveyed adults who take melatonin use the gummy form — but a recent study suggests the contents of gummies might have dangerous levels of melatonin and even CBD.

title: Lawyer for California teachers: Schools requiring them to lie to parents about kids’ gender identity
description: California teachers are filing a federal lawsuit against their school over policies concerning students' gender identity.

title: Temple visits up in China as unemployed college graduates pray to find jobs
description: Jobless university graduates in China are seeking solace in temples as they struggle to find employment in an economy still recovering from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Stars bounce Wild in 6 with 4-1 win behind Hintz, Oettinger
description: The Dallas Stars defeated the Minnesota Wild 4-1 on Friday to win the first round NHL series in six games. Jake Oettinger had 22 saves for the Stars.

title: Florida passes bill allowing DeSantis to run for president without resigning
description: The Florida legislature passed final approval Friday for a bill that would allow the state governor to run for president without resigning from his current office.

title: Mike Tyson wishes he used psychedelics in his prime: ‘A better fighter’
description: Former heavyweight champion Mike Tyson touted the use of psychedelics, saying he wish he used them during his fighting career as he thinks they would have made him a better fighter.

title: Educator and school shooting survivor touts new ‘wellness model’ for kids that will prevent school shootings
description: Ex-school principal and school shooting survivor Jerry Sparby told Fox News about the tragedy that prompted him to dedicate his life to helping students.

title: Portland driver records 'terrifying' attack on car by homeless man: 'Thought he was going to make it inside'
description: Drug counselor Kevin Dahlgren says the attack by a homeless man wielding a rock in Portland, Oregon highlights the state's failure to address mental health.

title: North Korea threatens to deploy more nuclear assets as US prepares to send submarine
description: North Korean ruling family member Kim Yo Jong commented on South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's speech before the US Congress, calling the world leader a "fool."

title: Massive Crimea oil depot fire caused by drone strike, governor says
description: A massive fire at an oil reservoir in Crimea Saturday was caused by a Ukrainian drone strike on the facility, according to a Russia-appointed governor.

title: Trump sidesteps another question about support for a nationwide abortion ban
description: Former President Donald Trump sidestepped another question Thursday regarding whether he would sign a 15-week federal abortion ban, should he be re-elected in 2024.

title: Russian ransomware attack software targets Apple Mac and MacBook
description: Kurt "The CyberGuy" Knutsson explains how a type of ransomware called "LockBit" is attacking Mac computers and what steps you should take to protect yourself.

title: Mild winter could mean an uptick in ticks, Lyme disease across the US
description: Some experts are saying this year's mild winter will lead to an uptick in ticks and tick-borne diseases. Learn more about these parasitic pests.

title: Lakers obliterate Grizzlies 125-85, advance to 2nd round
description: The Los Angeles Lakers blew out the Memphis Grizzlies in Game 6 and will move on to the play either the Sacramento Kings or the Golden State Warriors.

title: Sculpture of Spain’s controversial ex-king puzzles tourists
description: A new statue depicting former Spanish King Juan Carlos has been placed in Madrid. The statue refers to Carlos' passion for big-game hunting, which landed him in a scandal in 2012.

title: East Palestine resident experiencing lesions, stomach pain, shortness of breath since train derailment
description: Resident Courtney Miller speaks out as health concerns grow after the Feb. 3 train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio.

title: With Biden as oldest US president in reelection bid, health experts call for ‘complete transparency’
description: Is there an age considered too old for a person to be president of the U.S.? Joe Biden's decision to run for reelection has reignited the debate about fitness for office — health experts weigh in.

title: Jack Nicholson cheers courtside for Los Angeles Lakers' playoff game for first time in two years
description: 86-year-old legendary Hollywood actor Jack Nicholson returned to courtside seats during the Los Angeles Lakers versus Memphis Grizzlies at the NBA playoff series.

title: Republicans have the upper hand over Dems in debt ceiling negotiations, budget expert says
description: A budget expert from the Heritage Foundation told Fox News Digital that the Republicans have the upper hand over President Biden and the Democrats in the debt ceiling negotiations.

title: Snake somehow manages to swallow this creature: 'What a sight to see'
description: The Fox News Lifestyle Newsletter brings you trending stories on family, travel, food, neighbors helping neighbors, pets, autos, military veterans, heroes, faith and American values.

title: Michelle Pfeiffer turns 65: Al Pacino cast her in 'Scarface' over this bloody move
description: Michelle Pfeiffer is celebrating her 65th birthday. Take a look back at her impressive career in Hollywood and her legacy in the business.

title: Georgia dog that vanished 6 years ago found wandering about 450 miles away in another state: 'This is insane'
description: A pit bull that went missing in Georgia in 2017 will be reunited with his owner after he recently turned up in wandering around a lake in West Virginia.

title: Richard Dreyfuss: Americans' ignorance of Constitution, disrespect for opposition has damaged our country
description: Actor Richard Dreyfuss urged the importance of educating Americans about U.S. history and civics to uphold our unique values that make this country great.

title: Crime-troubled NC tourist town pays $75 an hour to county sheriff's deputies to help back up city cops
description: Deputies with the Buncombe County Sheriff's Office in North Carolina are raking in $75 per hour in overtime to assist the Asheville Police Department in patrolling downtown.

title: I went through the juvenile justice system. Now, I'm fighting to change it
description: There are countless examples of community programs that successfully help youth get on a better path. I am living proof of what's possible when people believe in you.

title: I 'reclaimed my freedom' to speak up as a woman for female sports: Former ESPN reporter
description: Former ESPN reporter Charly Arnolt told Fox News host Sean Hannity that she now has the 'freedom' to share her views on transgender issues within sports.

title: 'I Can' movie tells inspirational true story of All-American athlete Katelyn Pavey: ‘Gift from God’
description: All-American athlete Katelyn Pavey's story is the subject of a new movie, "I Can," from Kappa Studios. Pavey was born with a condition that halted the growth of her left arm.

title: Texas shooting leaves 5 dead, including 8-year-old; manhunt underway
description: Five people from Honduras were fatally shot early Saturday morning in southern San Jacinto County, Texas, according to the San Jacinto County Sheriff's Office.

title: The one thing your children want from you before you die
description: Your loved ones care deeply about you. But they don't care as deeply about most of what you've accumulated over the course of your life. It's time to take a hard look at all your stuff.

title: Chicago pastors march to help teens who led violent 'takeover' in city: 'Moral and ethical thing to do'
description: Chicago pastor and activist Tavis Grant told Fox News Digital how churches organized a march in support of Black youth, offering them jobs after a violent "teen takeover" in the city.

title: Utah rescue dog is looking for a new home: Leo will be 'right by your side’
description: A male dog in Utah is looking for a home after spending over two years at an animal sanctuary. Leo is a 4-year-old shepherd mix and known as a "wiggly" dog.

title: Amy Grant’s bike crash inspired her to appreciate God and enjoy life’s 'fourth quarter'
description: Grammy Award-winning singer Amy Grant opened up about the changes she has made in the "fourth quarter" of her life at the Frederick K.C. Price III Christian Schools' Earth Day Celebration.

title: Montana Gov. Greg Gianforte signs bill banning transgender treatments for minors
description: Montana Republican Gov. Greg Gianforte signed a bill on Friday banning puberty blockers, cross-sex hormones and transgender surgeries for minors.

title: CRISIS IN KENSINGTON: Resident says neighborhood 'given to the wolves,' begs people to stop feeding addicts
description: Local welfare and food handouts might seem like humanitarian work in Philadelphia's open-air drug market, but one activist sees a big problem.

title: President Biden slams 'MAGA Republicans' as the 'real problem' at DNC reception
description: President Biden warned at a reception for the DNC that American freedom and democracy are under attack by "MAGA Republicans" he claims are trying to stop progress.

title: What is ChatGPT?
description: ChatGPT is a generative AI chatbot developed by OpenAI, a California-based tech company. Its capabilities include conversing with humans, suggesting creative and computer edits and more.

title: After ‘fake Drake’ opens copyright questions, lawyer answers if artists can protect their style against AI
description: A lawyer weighs in on the recent 'fake Drake' AI debacle, explaining whether existing U.S. copyright law allows artists to copyright their individual style.

title: McCarthy takes Congress back to school on AI
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy is urging Congress to pump the brakes on talk of potential AI legislation until lawmakers can learn more about it from experts.

title: Musician Bonnie Raitt postpones tour dates over 'medical situation'
description: Musician Bonnie Raitt is rescheduling upcoming performances planned for next month because of a “medical situation" that requires surgery.

title: LAURA INGRAHAM: The left is on a search and destroy mission against classic American literature
description: Laura Ingraham discusses how the Democrats have pushed sexually explicit novels on kids in schools on "The Ingraham Angle."

title: Patrick Swayze's widow Lisa Niemi recalls first signs of his pancreatic cancer: 'I’m continuing his fight'
description: Patrick Swayze's widow Lisa Niemi Swayze remembers the actor's first symptoms of pancreatic cancer. The "Dirty Dancing" star died from the disease at the age of 57 in 2009.

title: On this day in history, April 29, 2004, World War II Memorial opens in Washington, D.C.: 'Stirs memories'
description: The World War II Memorial opened to the public on this day in history, April 29, 2004, after more than two years of work on its construction. It honors the lives lost in WWII.
